abstract.p: Masafumi Okanda, former president of Liquid Audio Japan, which licenses software technology from Liquid Audio of Redwood City, Calif, is arrested on suspicion that he abducted former director of company and held him captive for three days in June 1999; police decline to identify victim or to say what Okanda's motive might have been (S)

block.p: The former president of Liquid Audio Japan, which licenses software technology from Liquid Audio of Redwood City, Calif., was arrested on suspicion that he abducted a colleague and held him captive, according to the police. The former executive, Masafumi Okanda, 32, who quit the Japanese company last month, is suspected of kidnapping a former director of the company and holding him captive for three days in June 1999. The police declined to identify the victim or to say what Mr. Okanda's motive might have been. Both Liquid Audio Japan and Liquid Audio provide secure music delivery systems for online music retail stores.
